revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-19 05:16:29.000000000', 'message': 'Replace deprecated with_lockmode with with_for_update

The Query.with_lockmode() method is deprecated since version 0.9.0
and will be removed in a future release. [1]
This patch replaces it with Query.with_for_update().

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/orm/query.html#sqlalchemy.orm.query.Query.with_lockmode

Change-Id: I78e692e08440afc38ac2697fabfa566fff5f0a9f
'}]
commit_message:
Replace deprecated with_lockmode with with_for_update

The Query.with_lockmode() method is deprecated since version 0.9.0
and will be removed in a future release. [1]
This patch replaces it with Query.with_for_update().

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/orm/query.html#sqlalchemy.orm.query.Query.with_lockmode

Change-Id: I78e692e08440afc38ac2697fabfa566fff5f0a9f

commit_message:
Make cron jobs generator command task in keystone non-changing

The task does not change any state but is used to set a fact
from parsed output.

Also adjust task name.

Change-Id: I5fe322546d82a373522645485be18fe7bfc57999
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 802dfce4a854ef6f30827a2223c0ca7a73226f7a)

'}, {'created': '2019-05-17 14:04:32.000000000', 'message': "Fix overcloud introspection data save

If running 'kayobe overcloud introspection data save' in an environment
where nodes have been registered in the seed's ironic service manually
(rather than through auto-discovery), previously the bifrost ansible
inventory would not have been populated.

commit_message:
Fix overcloud introspection data save

If running 'kayobe overcloud introspection data save' in an environment
where nodes have been registered in the seed's ironic service manually
(rather than through auto-discovery), previously the bifrost ansible
inventory would not have been populated.

This change ensures the bifrost ansible inventory exists prior to
collecting introspection data.

Change-Id: I2ad53aa0db3bab8db6d6d9de4b00c5dac756fb15

[{'account_id': 30220, 'date': '2019-06-13 10:09:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30220, 'date': '2019-06-13 10:34:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16353, 'date': '2019-06-13 13:15:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30220, 'date': '2019-06-14 08:24:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 16353, 'date': '2019-06-14 08:27:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

some copy and paste issues'}, {'account_id': 30220, 'date': '2019-06-14 08:30:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 16353, 'date': '2019-06-14 13:35:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

It would be really great to get input from cores on which version of OpenStack to use in combination with the new bionic images. Thank you.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-06-18 08:46:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I would now add a change in osh-images/openstack/loci to match this change, so that ppl can still build it manually outside gates.

It's not necessary per se, but I like them to be in sync."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-06-18 08:47:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> It would be really great to get input from cores on which version
 > of OpenStack to use in combination with the new bionic images.
 > Thank you.

This creates the master and rocky for bionic, which sounds okay to me, not really sure what you meant there.
We can have jobs for those if that's what you meant ?"}, {'account_id': 16353, 'date': '2019-06-18 09:47:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > It would be really great to get input from cores on which version
 > > of OpenStack to use in combination with the new bionic images.
 > > Thank you.
 > 
 > This creates the master and rocky for bionic, which sounds okay to
 > me, not really sure what you meant there.
 > We can have jobs for those if that's what you meant ?

My question was targeting which version of OpenStack we should go for: bionic + {rocky, octa, queens, all_of_them}. To my undestanding, mainly Ocata is being used today (at least in Airship). By bumping both the version of the container OS AND OpenStack, we introduce more potetial for issues. From this perspective, I would go for bionic and ocata, but I wanted to get input from cores in terms of known issues, roadmap, etc..."}, {'account_id': 30220, 'date': '2019-06-24 10:01:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 30220, 'date': '2019-06-24 12:21:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2019-06-26 00:02:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2019-06-26 03:15:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

It would be great to see this through - building rocky and stein images with python 3.

I'm not sure of the value of master builds or that of building ocata with bionic? both of we could add as additions at a later date if desired."}, {'account_id': 30220, 'date': '2019-06-26 09:30:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 30220, 'date': '2019-06-26 10:56:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 30220, 'date': '2019-06-26 12:23:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2019-06-26 13:00:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30220, 'date': '2019-06-26 13:53:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 30220, 'date': '2019-06-26 13:57:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> It would be great to see this through - building rocky and stein
 > images with python 3.
 > 
 > I'm not sure of the value of master builds or that of building
 > ocata with bionic? both of we could add as additions at a later
 > date if desired.

Done. 
I introduced bionic-master 1)to stick to the existing format for xenial based build jobs 2) i felt its easier to derive/add new openstack version based child jobs with the master specified as the parent job. But we can remove it as well if its adding complexity. I removed ocata for now."}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2019-06-26 14:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2019-06-26 14:43:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add bionic based build jobs to Zuul build configuraton

This patch adds bionic based build jobs to Zuul config
to create loci images based on Bionic.

Change-Id: I8f691908b8f7aa482e716559e9e1422f2d4d5d6c

subject: WIP: clean libvirt teardown process
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-27 15:09:45.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: clean teardown process

Avoid abusive use of ignore_errors during teardown which prevented
us from spotting logic bugs.

New code should not display Ansible errors if the teardown works as
expected: at the end not having any VMs running or defined. This code
should work regardless the presense or absence of these VMs, following
the delete-if-found logic.

Note: when testing this using reproducer remember that by default
it uses only master from tq[e], so you need to hack it to force it to
use this specific change (cherry pick and disable cloning).

Change-Id: Ie8a2265ec266b0db1423cec190534c1c0f04d77f

commit_message:
WIP: clean libvirt teardown process

Avoid abusive use of ignore_errors during teardown which prevented
us from spotting logic bugs.

New code should not display Ansible errors if the teardown works as
expected and at the end we do not have any VMs running or defined.

This code should work regardless the presense or absence of these VMs,
following a delete-if-found logic.

Note: when testing this using reproducer remember that by default
it uses only master from tq[e], so you need to hack it to force it to
use this specific change (cherry pick and disable cloning).

Change-Id: Ie8a2265ec266b0db1423cec190534c1c0f04d77f

commit_message:
Add nova-multi-cell job to experimental queue

Nova has had a multi-cell job (nova-multi-cell) since the
Train release but is currently non-voting in the check queue
for nova changes. This change adds the job to the experimental
queue for devstack changes so we can test changes to devstack
and make sure they work for the multi-cell job.

Change-Id: Icf31baf6fd4313aec5ecfb9e8f9cbcef1ff7f61d

commit_message:
Support standalone placement in the devstack

The placement service has a separate config file that also needs to be
modified if osprofiler is enabled in devstack.

commit_message:
Make the workgroup status more robust

The current charm does not indicated to the end user when a specific
resource is not running. Neither does it indicate when a node is offline
or stopped.

Validate that configured resources are actually running and let the end
user know if they are not.

Closes-Bug: #1834263

Change-Id: I1171e71ae3b015b4b838b7ecf0de18eb10d7c8f2

subject: WIP: Add Molecule tests for the role xfs-check-ftype.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 11491, 'name': 'Gael Chamoulaud', 'email': 'gchamoul@redhat.com', 'username': 'gchamoul'}, {'_account_id': 24162, 'name': 'Sorin Sbârnea', 'display_name': 'zbr', 'email': 'ssbarnea@redhat.com', 'username': 'ssbarnea', 'status': 'do not feed the troll 🥕'}, {'_account_id': 25877, 'name': 'Luke Short', 'email': 'ekultails@gmail.com', 'username': 'ekultails'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-06-26 14:37:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-06-26 14:41:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We should not add molecule patches before enabling the jobs. We can reparent it on one that adds openstack-tox-molecule job.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-06-26 14:41:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The biggest problem I am running into is not being able to reliably assign raw images to a loop device. Another issue we may have later on is if the test environment has XFS partitions it could cause some false-positives because the --privileged flag is being passed to docker. I need to re-evaluate the capabilities it has so it does not see the hypervisor's /dev/ devices."}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-06-26 14:41:35.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to molecule'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-06-26 14:42:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Luke, any reason to propose this patch directly in stable/stein? and not in master first?'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-06-26 14:43:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Sorin, yes I should have stated that in my commit message that we first new Molecule jobs. The validations team is only looking for a proof-of-concept right now.

Gael, oops I meant to use master. That was my bad.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-06-26 14:43:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Just ping me if it fails on zuul. I can try to help to find a way to fix it. AFAIK we test on Ubuntu so no XFS involved but we could even switch distro if needed.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-06-26 14:50:40.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Thanks Sorin. Glad to hear we shouldn't have any conflicts with XFS.

I have migrated this patch set upstream to master here: https://review.opendev.org/667638"}]

subject: Deprecate ConfigFilter
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-17 17:51:09.000000000', 'message': "Deprecate ConfigFilter

There are no existing users of this class[0], and I believe there were
some fundamental problems with the design that we never addressed.
As I recall, this is because we adopted the policy that other projects
should never use config opts they didn't define, so there's no real
need for this feature now.

I'm proposing that we deprecate this for only one cycle and remove it
in U. While this doesn't fit our usual deprecation policy, the fact
that the module has no known users makes me think it's not worth
waiting the full two cycles we normally would.

Change-Id: I04baae695a7ba0bb93c91ea642c4e33c04bf87bd
0: http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=ConfigFilter&i=nope&files=&repos=
"}]
commit_message:
Deprecate ConfigFilter

There are no existing users of this class[0], and I believe there were
some fundamental problems with the design that we never addressed.
As I recall, this is because we adopted the policy that other projects
should never use config opts they didn't define, so there's no real
need for this feature now.

I'm proposing that we deprecate this for only one cycle and remove it
in U. While this doesn't fit our usual deprecation policy, the fact
that the module has no known users makes me think it's not worth
waiting the full two cycles we normally would.

Change-Id: I04baae695a7ba0bb93c91ea642c4e33c04bf87bd
0: http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=ConfigFilter&i=nope&files=&repos=

commit_message:
Replace merge_configs with merge_yaml for merge mongodb.conf

Actually, 'mongodb.conf' is a yaml format configuration file. Do not use
merge_configs to merge it.

Change-Id: Id3c006df00c1e2d66472c2195781e01c640cab22

commit_message:
Import "Manage Networking service quotas" admin guide

This copies the guide from openstack-manuals [1] which should
have been done with the manuals docs migration in Pike. The
only content change is a todo is added to migrate the guide
from using the deprecated neutron CLIs to the openstack CLIs.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/ocata/admin-guide/cli-networking-advanced-quotas.html

Change-Id: Ia0cad1ea0c27067bc257c1fc8e05299052e35e1b
Closes-Bug: #1834068

commit_message:
Horizon: Set SECURE_PROXY_ADDR_HEADER

Setting this to HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR will display the IP in
X-Forwarded-For header instead of REMOTE_ADDR. This is to display
client's IP.

Change-Id: Ifab508f2c3e39de69e3b1423b6aab57e333fc37e

commit_message:
Update json module to jsonutils

oslo project provide jsonutils, and neutronclient use it in many place[1],
this PS to update the remained json module to oslo jsonutils for
consistency.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/python-neutronclient/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=jsonutils&type=

Change-Id: Ic4639628c8910b88a14b0fe8f37638bb4f9474be
(cherry picked from commit 1f35b8f25cb328ede6aea7933ecd33a1cd713ba8)

commit_message:
Change to use mkisofs for SUSE Nova image

SUSE Nova image installs mkisofs instead of genisoimage. Set the
mkisofs_cmd property in nova.conf to mkisofs.

Change-Id: I4a5b53da6684e006c661df0bf1f1a7c17d8058b4

commit_message:
Make tempest job use Python3

From python3 range returns immutable sequence of numbers [0], instead of
a list.
[0]: https://docs.python.org/3.7/library/stdtypes.html#typesseq-range

Change-Id: I2664e551896629838a8b2c090ecec05714e11f76

subject: Add Horizon to 'Help most needed' list
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 1736, 'name': 'Ivan Kolodyazhny', 'email': 'e0ne@e0ne.info', 'username': 'e0ne'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 10607, 'name': 'Alexandra Settle', 'email': 'a.settle@outlook.com', 'username': 'asettle'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-01-29 18:35:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-01-29 18:36:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-01-29 19:59:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I wonder if we need a subsection specifically for projects that really need more contributors. Designate and Glance are still in a risky state as far as I've seen, but there are others that are not listed here as well.

We could maybe remove Documentation? It is always an area that needs help, but at least with moving most docs into each project, it seems like there is some level of ownership there. Granted, still not as actively maintained as we would prefer, but not like something that will stop working and go away without more owners.

It probably is a good time to have another conversation about this list anyway in the TC."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-01-29 21:33:59.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from help-most-needed-horizon to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-01-30 15:02:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> It probably is a good time to have another conversation about this
 > list anyway in the TC.

Agreed. Based on what I've seen many, maybe even most [1], projects are lacking reviewers, committers, contributors of all sorts so picking a few here and there to highlight without a specific requirement on some task limits the focus and value of the list: it's hard to act if the ask is "we need help, any help".

I agree with Ivan (and Sean) that we need to have this discussion and figure out what's going on, even if it merely means resetting our expectations.

There _might_ be some ways we can do some culture jamming, similar to what we need did with the "don't nit so much" efforts from a while back. Things like giving advice on which code to review first (older reviews, either review or abandon; review bug fixes before features; fix bugs before working on feaures; etc are all potential ideas, I'm sure there are many more).'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-01-30 15:05:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Agreed. Based on what I've seen many, maybe even most [1], projects
 > are lacking reviewers, committers, contributors of all sorts so
 > picking a few here and there to highlight without a specific
 > requirement on some task limits the focus and value of the list:
 > it's hard to act if the ask is "we need help, any help".

I forgot the [1]

[1] Even in nova, much of the last 6 months has felt comparatively very slow and quiet for review bandwidth (on both specs and code). I'd argue this is the new normal and not something that can actually be changed without a major change by contributing companies, which at this stage of the maturity cycle seems unlikely (and potentially unnecessary).'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-01-31 09:29:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I agree we could refactor the Glance/Designate/Horizon entries into a "help in critical base projects"...

But it's also a good time to revisit the usefulness of this list. We discussed in the past the need to turn it more into a sort of "community job board" with clearer requirements/benefits, but the fear to see a very large, unprioritized list kind of stalled that effort.

I am now wondering if we should not merge this effort with mentoring -- offer to 1:1 mentor new blood that would show up to help in a very specific area.

I'll start a ML thread on this topic.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-02-19 01:15:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I agree we could refactor the Glance/Designate/Horizon entries into
 > a "help in critical base projects"...
 > 
 > But it's also a good time to revisit the usefulness of this list.
 > We discussed in the past the need to turn it more into a sort of
 > "community job board" with clearer requirements/benefits, but the
 > fear to see a very large, unprioritized list kind of stalled that
 > effort.
 > 
 > I am now wondering if we should not merge this effort with
 > mentoring -- offer to 1:1 mentor new blood that would show up to
 > help in a very specific area.
 
+1 to the question, although I think merging is the wrong path forward. Mentoring doesn't provide visibility to businesses seeking to help.  Mentoring is still required to get people up to speed... Mentoring also doesn't help present a value proposition.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-02-19 01:17:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Two thoughts in-line. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-03-07 13:10:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This change should be part of a larger discussion on how to change/evolve how we designate and communicate priority areas of work. (together with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/637025/ and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/636956/)'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2019-03-11 17:33:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-03-14 15:17:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-03-25 11:53:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-06-14 10:42:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hey Ivan,

With the changes proposed here: https://review.opendev.org/657447 This patch will probably become defunct.

I suggest potentially abandoning this patch, and syncing up with Zane for the inclusion into the investment opportunities patch :)

Cheers,

Alex'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-06-26 13:27:41.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

abandoning as per Alex's comments (and lack of update from Ivan's side :))"}]

commit_message:
Add support for /v2/scope API endpoint to the client

This allows to retrieve the state of one or several scopes through the API via
the client library and cli tool.

Change-Id: I53995062fe76100f6dfcc672af482f653cc85bde
Story: 2005395
Task: 30795
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/658073/

commit_message:
Add docker socket inside neutron_l3_agent container

This will allow to use the new neutron "kill script" feature, allowing
to make the agent clean and drop its container agents instead of keeping
them dangling.
Relates to https://review.opendev.org/663528

commit_message:
Update contributiing docs for readability and correctness

The contributing docs have been updated to correct the file name pathing
and to update the basic noted job structure so that it matches what is
currently being executed.

Role title names have been adjusted to make them all uniform.

Change-Id: I6250a6dcf33caef599fe2bc25f90eea3b8d53d1e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-19 07:53:14.000000000', 'message': "WIP Implement the transport options

With this feature, it is possible to specialize the parameters to send.
`options = oslo_messaging.TransportOptions(transport,
at_least_once=True)`

TransportOptions is decoded for every single driver,
for example in RabbitMQ driver is used to handle the mandatory flag.

Notes:
  - This is a WIP
  - The idea of creating a new  class TransportOptions is because I'd like
    to have an abstract class not related only to the RPCClient
  - at_least_once is the first parameter, when needed we can add the
    others.
  - get_options() returns a dictionary that can be parsed easily for each
    driver.
  - tests don't work

Implements: blueprint transport-options (second point)

The blueprint link is
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/transport-options

Change-Id: I1858e4a990507d3c2bac2ef7fbef75d8c2dbfce2

commit_message:
Implement the transport options

With this feature, it is possible to specialize the parameters to send.
`options = oslo_messaging.TransportOptions(at_least_once=True)`

TransportOptions is used in every single driver,
for example in RabbitMQ driver is used to handle the mandatory flag.

Notes:
  - The idea of creating a new  class TransportOptions is because I'd like
    to have an abstract class not related only to the RPCClient
  - at_least_once is the first parameter, when needed we can add the
    others.

Implements: blueprint transport-options (second point)

The blueprint link is [1]
To test it you can use [2]

1- https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/transport-options
2- https://github.com/Gsantomaggio/rabbitmq-utils/
   tree/master/openstack/mandatory_test

Change-Id: I1858e4a990507d3c2bac2ef7fbef75d8c2dbfce2

subject: Add OsProfiler config options to generated reference
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-26 12:52:39.000000000', 'message': "Add OsProfiler config options to generated reference

OsProfiler is optional, but if it's installed we'll load up the configuration
options from the library, but they weren't in the generated config sample so
people would have to find the osprofiler docs, or worse the code, to figure
out how to configure it.

This simply adds the OsProfiler config options to the config sample, which
will also show up in the config reference docs.

Change-Id: I4cd2c27b11c67ac67ace22bc43e09add8ac05bf0
Story: 2005842
Task: 34191
"}]
commit_message:
Add OsProfiler config options to generated reference

OsProfiler is optional, but if it's installed we'll load up the configuration
options from the library, but they weren't in the generated config sample so
people would have to find the osprofiler docs, or worse the code, to figure
out how to configure it.

This simply adds the OsProfiler config options to the config sample, which
will also show up in the config reference docs.

Change-Id: I4cd2c27b11c67ac67ace22bc43e09add8ac05bf0
Story: 2005842
Task: 34191

only the default 'overcloud' name works.

commit_message:
Add --overcloud-ssh-network

In some cases, we may not want to always assume the ctlplane as the
network to use for both ssh access to the overcloud nodes, and for
generating the ansible inventory. This patches adds a new cli argument,
--overcloud-ssh-network that can be used to set the network name to be
used. Defaults to ctlplane.

Depends-On: I1e3f9a5142bff5e4f77e5e40df164089d9144652
Change-Id: I767984623c7d2402b10bae3d30b695783166f6bf
(cherry picked from commit a1c01dfc7af09f4ffbb5e6306b2af444172aa75f)

commit_message:
Add ssh_network input

In some cases, we may not want to always assume the ctlplane as the network to
use for generating the ansible inventory. This patches adds a new workflow
input, ssh_network that can be used to set the network name to be used.
Defaults to ctlplane.

Change-Id: I1e3f9a5142bff5e4f77e5e40df164089d9144652
(cherry picked from commit 5ef16ada8df16852b00f56601c306fa57a1967b2)

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-25 17:06:51.000000000', 'message': '[CI] Add bindep.txt

Bindep is a tool for checking the presence of binary
packages needed to use an application / library. It
started life as a way to make it easier to set up a
development environment for OpenStack projects.

Infra has been looking to drop the global
bindep_fallback.txt [1][2] file for all
OpenStack projects, they recommend that projects
maintain their own with packages as necessary.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-infra/2018-April/005926.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/006888.html
Change-Id: I1824f132b0ffadc6c9179582d37295f3abed355f
(cherry picked from commit 1709fd7fc222f81bcbedc05e683d2eec5337edcc)

commit_message:
[CI] Add bindep.txt

Bindep is a tool for checking the presence of binary
packages needed to use an application / library. It
started life as a way to make it easier to set up a
development environment for OpenStack projects.

Infra has been looking to drop the global
bindep_fallback.txt [1][2] file for all
OpenStack projects, they recommend that projects
maintain their own with packages as necessary.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-infra/2018-April/005926.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/006888.html
Change-Id: I1824f132b0ffadc6c9179582d37295f3abed355f
(cherry picked from commit 1709fd7fc222f81bcbedc05e683d2eec5337edcc)

commit_message:
Enable Ceph RGW 'account in url' option

This requires an update of the endpoint but is necessary to be able
to use public-readable containers (like temporary URLs) with RGW.

Change-Id: I6bd11bdf9c74db24c0d21fa600030e9f3b144df0
Closes-Bug: 1826894
(cherry picked from commit 7c379543ccab831da0bf4f8f4b850b534d5c5247)

commit_message:
Make cron jobs generator command task in keystone non-changing

The task does not change any state but is used to set a fact
from parsed output.

Also adjust task name.

Change-Id: I5fe322546d82a373522645485be18fe7bfc57999
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 29970, 'date': '2019-06-10 09:24:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2019-06-11 12:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2019-06-14 14:06:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Wow, I've been chasing that bug in the Java version for months.  See https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2005305

On the Java side, I had not determined it was the ttl but rather suspected it was a cache miss that caused it to do an update rather than an insert."}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2019-06-25 18:27:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

I think we need to merge this ASAP, but also I don't think this goes far enough. I suspect there is a problem with TTL and how the persister behavior is in the Cassandra driver for Monasca Persister in both Java and Python versions.
I'm going to go hack a Java version of this change now."}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2019-06-25 19:30:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2019-06-25 19:51:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I posted a WIP on an equivalent for Java.  https://review.opendev.org/667447

We will want to backport these as far as possible as well.'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2019-06-25 21:32:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Passed gates, I'm giving it +2 as a 'quick fix' for the issue.

I wish we had a unit test for this, but the behavior is in Cassandra so it requires a functional test to verify."}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-06-26 11:04:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-10 09:24:46.000000000', 'message': 'cassandra metrics_id contain null value bug

metrics table in cassandra always contain row which has no metric_id.
it is casused by cassandra ttl.cassandra supports TTL column only,
so when update a row,metric_id must update as well.

Change-Id: Ia2d2e1585965dd31f9679e2a63497bf4cc68349e
Story: 2005832
Task: 33590
'}]
commit_message:
cassandra metrics_id contain null value bug

metrics table in cassandra always contain row which has no metric_id.
it is casused by cassandra ttl.cassandra supports TTL column only,
so when update a row,metric_id must update as well.

Change-Id: Ia2d2e1585965dd31f9679e2a63497bf4cc68349e
Story: 2005832
Task: 33590

commit_message:
Deduplicate scenario job file patterns

There is no reason to have different trigger file patterns for
check and gate.

By moving these to parent job definition we can reuse them in the
template not only to avoid deduplication between check and gate but
also be able to reuse them in other jobs.

Change-Id: Id196ef6c5afb19046d2ca584f0d61cddd8396798

commit_message:
Tests: Using bmc_addresss for node_driver_info

The _check_existing_nodes and create_node functions using node_driver_info,
this value is a result of utils.get_ipmi_address_from_data.
So it's better to use 'bmc_address' from Inventory.

Also using more elaborate introspection_data.

Change-Id: I36e9187d66025170d682ae5f431015f0786305fa

commit_message:
Add wait.resources.type to armada manifest

This change adds various wait.resources.type to the armada
manifest for each openstack service.

Change-Id: I6015344c9fcf175bab076fc5c81dfe7778d421ee

Add admonition for manual config-download with Ceph

Show how to pass CephAnsibleEnvironmentVariables when
running config-download manually to configure Ceph.

commit_message:
Add default for the container_image option

This creates a default option for `tripleo_container_image` and a failure condition
when the option is undefined.

Closes-Bug: #1834283
Change-Id: Ice80e74b177bfaeedc22f51572e434c01dea18fc
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
Do not run Zuul kolla-ansible-base jobs when modifying globals.yml

The file is not used in Zuul jobs. It is templated independently.

Change-Id: Ia39898cdb165e30dab74de727048be2ebb2290c8
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Freeze libvirt image with date

This starts an alternative approach to the use of Zuul's date time,
whose fact availability is inconsistent across check/gates/promote
pipeline.

This implements an alternative approach for testing in the promote
pipeline.

Change-Id: Ib41797cabbb226ee35daab9f886fa0fc38120c32

commit_message:
Add minion installation

Add the ability to install an undercloud minion which is connected to an
original undercloud. This minion can have either heat-engine or
ironic-conductor deployed on it.

Adds two new openstack commands for the minion install and a new
minion.conf can be used to configure them.

openstack undercloud minion install
openstack undercloud minion upgrade

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/656984
Change-Id: I61832f5088be172eaf31b36a9cca8dc289580bb2
Related-Blueprint: undercloud-minion

commit_message:
Update the "admin/configuration" section of the documentation

This replaces the out-of-date "admin/configuration" section of the
documentation with a step-by-step configuration guide.

Change-Id: I2268ead54d0c0651c364bf790f1f17a16f28ab39
Story: 2004179
Task: 29063

commit_message:
Add support for the chrony implementation

Chronyd is installed and configured by default since the Stein
Cycle. This patch adds the support of the latter.

This patch also renames the 'ntpstat' playbook and role by 'ntp' which
is more generic.

Change-Id: Ica0d4af5faa1693baa8f336db71143e0457401f0
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

This fixes the whitespace chomps for adding extra volumes and
volume mounts via values.yaml for the Fluentd chart, as currently
too much whitespace is removed and the extra volumes and mounts
are not added correctly

Fluentd: Fix whitespace chomps for volumes and volume mounts

This fixes the whitespace chomps for adding extra volumes and
volume mounts via values.yaml for the Fluentd chart, as currently
too much whitespace is removed and the extra volumes and mounts
are not added correctly

Change-Id: I9cf67c3321339078ac795a7290f441b16cc41d41
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Add bindep.txt for Octavia

Some base packages are no longer automatically included in zuul
job runs. This is good as we need to call out our platform package
requirements.
This patch adds a bindep.txt to Octavia to capture those
package requirements.

Change-Id: I48e82f39e3980d6d50e3b710326b8e437eddb08b

[{'created': '2019-06-03 16:06:32.000000000', 'message': "Use recommended configuration for apidoc

The documentation for apidoc recommends pointing the module_dir at
the module directory itself rather than the top-level directory for
the project so you don't have to explicitly omit setup.py or other
unpackaged Python files.

I did have to remove the _* exclusion because it was breaking in the
current version of Sphinx. It doesn't seem to be necessary in my
testing either. Private files are ignored anyway.

Change-Id: I2f1afcb2a20c3ee0bf8d52c294836e725b5a4e28
"}]
commit_message:
Use recommended configuration for apidoc

The documentation for apidoc recommends pointing the module_dir at
the module directory itself rather than the top-level directory for
the project so you don't have to explicitly omit setup.py or other
unpackaged Python files.

I did have to remove the _* exclusion because it was breaking in the
current version of Sphinx. It doesn't seem to be necessary in my
testing either. Private files are ignored anyway.

Change-Id: I2f1afcb2a20c3ee0bf8d52c294836e725b5a4e28

and clean up tox.ini a bit.

commit_message:
Switch cookiecutter tox job to use test_tox_targets.sh

This verifies that the thing we generate will actually pass its
defined tests. It's a superset of the tests we were running before.

Also adds git config calls to make this work in the gate where
the user details aren't already set.

Change-Id: I96810e7cf132304ca700ebedd0c43e3d4d56bbd4

commit_message:
Add UndercloudMinion environments

This adds a role and service files to support an undercloud minion that
runs additional services that connects to an undercloud.

Change-Id: Ib6fb39f7baa6972ea9879f4f29d7dd46487e2b8f
Related-Blueprint: undercloud-minion

commit_message:
Turn CIDR in query filter into proper subnet

Use netaddr.IPNetwork to convert CIDRs in a query
into proper subnets.

When creating subnets the CIDR is converted into
a proper subnet. i.e a subnet can be created with
cidr=10.0.0.11/24 in the create request. On create
the cidr is turned into a proper subnet resulting
in a subnet with cidr=10.0.0.0/24.

This change does the same to CIDRs when used as
query filters during a list subnet request, so
that the same value that was used to create the
subnet can be used to find the subnet.

Closes-Bug: #1831811
Change-Id: I8ae478a03ceedc6c3b1ae1d40081b5e5158813e6

Remove duplicated cinder::cron::db_purge::destination

... so that we do not have a useless line which is overwritten
by the other.

Change-Id: I329d151a09a747566430ab4032e0f4984f7d7e7b

commit_message:
nova-less-deploy: stop using glance for ironic-python-agent images

Ironic can use HTTP links or local files, and we already put the images to
a location accessible inside of ironic containers (for introspection).
This change switches to using file images for IPA. The existing Glance
images are not deleted since some nodes may be using them. Multi-arch
layout of [[PLATFORM-]ARCH/]agent.EXT is reused from the unit tests
of the `image upload` command, assuming that's what people are using.

Change-Id: Ie6fa04112e3348f429dc42b28442f8996ab03f29
Implements: blueprint nova-less-deploy
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663897/

commit_message:
Allow networks in roles_data to be dict or list

With the changes to make all networks for the overcloud
neutron routed networks it makes sense to change the
schema of 'networks' in roles_data to allow the user to
specify both the networks and the subnet of each network
for a role.

Ref change: I85676ae961d34bf6a986fa813c40380d50f09711

This changes the role yaml validation to allow 'networks'
to be either a list or a dict.

Related: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Change-Id: I773a38fd903fe287132151a4d178326a46890969

commit_message:
Fix placement_client group help docs generation

To get the placement_client OptGroup help text to generate
in the docs, we have to use the OptGroup object in the
list_opts() method rather than a string for the group name.

https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.config/latest/cli/generator.html#defining-option-discovery-entry-points

Change-Id: Ie728081caa205ded2435c6b95f5e8d4bbd23372c

messages:
[{'account_id': 29845, 'date': '2019-06-25 05:08:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-06-25 05:08:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-06-26 02:58:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hi Ikuo, please post this in master branch. The stable/stein branch is for Stein release, which is done.'}, {'account_id': 29845, 'date': '2019-06-26 06:51:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Branch mistake. Please see:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/667266/1'}]

commit_message:
Only iterate the list of zuul projects once when preparing repos

This merges the three previous tasks by a single task which prepares
the repository, whether it is cached or not and remove the git origin.

This is mostly an optimization so that we iterate through the list
one time instead of three.
This is not just for performance purposes but it also condenses all three
tasks into one, making it less verbose and easier to troubleshoot.

commit_message:
Remove comments about mirroring changes to nova/cells/messaging.py

The nova/cells/messaging.py module no longer exists so we can
remove the comments saying to mirror snapshot/backup changes
from the compute API to that cells v1 code.

Related to blueprint remove-cells-v1

Change-Id: Ic262af86bb848072f5bccd40df1809e5d752af85

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-20 22:07:40.000000000', 'message': 'Drop source node allocations if finish_resize fails

By the time finish_resize runs on the dest host, the instance
host/node values are already pointing at the dest (they are
set by resize_instance on the source compute before casting to
finish_resize on the dest). If finish_resize fails, the instance
is essentially stuck on the dest host so rather than revert the
allocations (which will drop the new flavor allocations against
the dest host where the instance now lives) we should just drop
the old flavor allocations on the source node resource provider,
which is what this change does.

The functional regression recreate test is updated to show this
working.

Change-Id: I52c8d038118c858004e17e71b2fba9e9e2714815
Closes-Bug: #1825537

commit_message:
Drop source node allocations if finish_resize fails

By the time finish_resize runs on the dest host, the instance
host/node values are already pointing at the dest (they are
set by resize_instance on the source compute before casting to
finish_resize on the dest). If finish_resize fails, the instance
is essentially stuck on the dest host so rather than revert the
allocations (which will drop the new flavor allocations against
the dest host where the instance now lives) we should just drop
the old flavor allocations on the source node resource provider,
which is what this change does.

The functional regression recreate test is updated to show this
working.

Change-Id: I52c8d038118c858004e17e71b2fba9e9e2714815
Closes-Bug: #1825537

commit_message:
Adjust repo namespace for pbr

This is a follow up for change Ifcfce490edb3d77e4e436e002d35bc909e1a057c
where the GIT_BASE was changed to the opendev URL to avoid redirects.
The pbr namespace in stackrc was old and still getting redirected and
this change fixes that.

Change-Id: Ib444e928fa2ca7650670f97be6927202333a1dd7

commit_message:
use AuthenticIPNetwork and AuthenticEUI from neutron-lib

This patch switches over to neutron-lib's version of the the
_AuthenticBase, AuthenticEUI and AuthenticIPNetwork classes by
deleting them from neutron and using lib's version instead.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/659881/

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: Ia3d3db401d6abcb9c9965b945bcd4c199f8e812b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-19 16:09:47.000000000', 'message': '[OVS] Network segmentation ID change not allowed if multisegments

If a network has several segments, the provider network segmentation ID
cannot be changed. This is defined in the feature spec [1].

In the case of having a multisegment network, the OVS agent RPC call
"get_network_details" will return the following value:

  {
    "network": {
      "updated_at": "2019-02-19T13:25:15Z",
      "revision_number": 5,
      "id": "ba973781-065b-4c69-9f07-a5c4f9a3b754",
      ...
      "segments": [{
        "provider:network_type": "vxlan",
        "provider:physical_network": null,
        "provider:segmentation_id": 10041
      },
      {
        "provider:network_type": "vxlan",
        "provider:physical_network": null,
        "provider:segmentation_id": 10066
      }],
      ...
}

The provider network information will be contained inside the "segments"
list, instead of being container in the parent "network" dictionary.

Closes-Bug: #1832745

[1]https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs/src/branch/master/specs/stein/change-segmentation-id-vlan-provider-network.rst

Change-Id: I4fa37519bbf91e93ebd2f0e46e4d14edd40728fd

[1]https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs/src/branch/master/specs/stein/change-segmentation-id-vlan-provider-network.rst

'}]
commit_message:
[OVS] Network segmentation ID change not allowed if multisegments

If a network has several segments, the provider network segmentation ID
cannot be changed. This is defined in the feature spec [1].

In the case of having a multisegment network, the OVS agent RPC call
"get_network_details" will return the following value:

  {
    "network": {
      "updated_at": "2019-02-19T13:25:15Z",
      "revision_number": 5,
      "id": "ba973781-065b-4c69-9f07-a5c4f9a3b754",
      ...
      "segments": [{
        "provider:network_type": "vxlan",
        "provider:physical_network": null,
        "provider:segmentation_id": 10041
      },
      {
        "provider:network_type": "vxlan",
        "provider:physical_network": null,
        "provider:segmentation_id": 10066
      }],
      ...
}

The provider network information will be contained inside the "segments"
list, instead of being container in the parent "network" dictionary.

Closes-Bug: #1832745

[1]https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs/src/branch/master/specs/stein/change-segmentation-id-vlan-provider-network.rst

Change-Id: I4fa37519bbf91e93ebd2f0e46e4d14edd40728fd

commit_message:
Fix removing non-last port from the group

When a firewall group has few ports, and some of those are removed
the status of the firewall group should not become INACTIVE

Change-Id: Ie3c0538ca31af9abb1b8c1cc5e4f6c3df9b16a1c
Closes-Bug: #1832450

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-25 11:50:42.000000000', 'message': 'Always Set dhcp_server in network_info

If enable_dhcp is set on subnet, but, for
some reason neutron did not have any DHCP port yet, we still
want the network_info to be populated with a valid dhcp_server
value. This is mostly useful for the metadata API (which is
relying on this value to give network_data to the instance).

This will also help some providers which are using external
DHCP servers not handled by neutron.
In this case, neutron will never create any DHCP port in the
subnet.

Also note that we cannot set the value to None because then the
value would be discarded by the metadata API.
So the subnet gateway will be used as fallback.

Change-Id: Ie2cd54c159ea693e48e00d0ca3b0ca5a468d79cb
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@corp.ovh.com>
(cherry picked from commit c7f572d65b57e034c1391ed49d84f6e5f1d672ad)
'}]
commit_message:
Always Set dhcp_server in network_info

If enable_dhcp is set on subnet, but, for
some reason neutron did not have any DHCP port yet, we still
want the network_info to be populated with a valid dhcp_server
value. This is mostly useful for the metadata API (which is
relying on this value to give network_data to the instance).

This will also help some providers which are using external
DHCP servers not handled by neutron.
In this case, neutron will never create any DHCP port in the
subnet.

Also note that we cannot set the value to None because then the
value would be discarded by the metadata API.
So the subnet gateway will be used as fallback.

Change-Id: Ie2cd54c159ea693e48e00d0ca3b0ca5a468d79cb
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@corp.ovh.com>
(cherry picked from commit c7f572d65b57e034c1391ed49d84f6e5f1d672ad)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-17 10:33:12.000000000', 'message': "FC: Ignore some HBAs from map for single WWNN

Current FC OS-Brick code only checks for single WWNN to exclude some
HBAs from scanning when we don't receive an initiator_target_map from
the backend.

There are storage arrays,like XtremIO, that due to their architecture
and design have all target ports automatically mapped to LUNs and are
returning the initiator_target_map, but some of those ports may not be
connected to our HBAs, so we end up with another case of bug #1765000.

This patch makes sure that we always check if the target implements
single WWNN, not only when we don't receive the initiator_target_map.

With this we decrease the likelihood of ending with unexpected devices
in our system, because now we will ignore unconnected HBAs (even if
reported in the initiator_target_map) if we are working with single WWNN
target.

Related-Bug: #1765000
Closes-Bug: #1828440
Change-Id: I02c208142f5b342f894666831449243863eccbfe
(cherry picked from commit 70899a9aa3e4bdd3f1b1a7024807390cd55c4958)
"}]
commit_message:
FC: Ignore some HBAs from map for single WWNN

Current FC OS-Brick code only checks for single WWNN to exclude some
HBAs from scanning when we don't receive an initiator_target_map from
the backend.

There are storage arrays,like XtremIO, that due to their architecture
and design have all target ports automatically mapped to LUNs and are
returning the initiator_target_map, but some of those ports may not be
connected to our HBAs, so we end up with another case of bug #1765000.

This patch makes sure that we always check if the target implements
single WWNN, not only when we don't receive the initiator_target_map.

With this we decrease the likelihood of ending with unexpected devices
in our system, because now we will ignore unconnected HBAs (even if
reported in the initiator_target_map) if we are working with single WWNN
target.

Related-Bug: #1765000
Closes-Bug: #1828440
Change-Id: I02c208142f5b342f894666831449243863eccbfe
(cherry picked from commit 70899a9aa3e4bdd3f1b1a7024807390cd55c4958)

commit_message:
Remove pylintrc file

This commit removes the pylintrc file. The pylint requirement was
removed 4 years ago[0] and we don't use it now. So, we can remove this
rc file safely.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/150816/

Change-Id: If032e7a345d5a612fbaaa6850e880c2a8601e718

The DDT tests were removed from neutron-lbaas in Rocky[1] as part
of another patch.
The gates have not run these tests since, at the latest, Mitaka
and they were never stable.
This patch is a "backport" of the removal of these non-functional
tests.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/561049/

Change-Id: I73d1824265cad4d24535d3a15b263491f12fde56
'}]
commit_message:
Remove DDT tests from tempest plugin

The DDT tests were removed from neutron-lbaas in Rocky[1] as part
of another patch.
The gates have not run these tests since, at the latest, Mitaka
and they were never stable.
This patch is a "backport" of the removal of these non-functional
tests.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/561049/

Change-Id: I73d1824265cad4d24535d3a15b263491f12fde56

commit_message:
Fix regression in validation action

Regression with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/656379/

self.stack is dict rather than a python object from action
heat.stacks_get  and is an input to this action.

Change-Id: I92c9d0bb5ddac5b8a887a3acf3fc3314aab5867b
Closes-Bug: #1834054
Related-Bug: #1826925

commit_message:
Replace /var/log/containers/swift symlink with directories

Once we remove the symlinks in update_staks, host_prep_tasks
would create those directories.

Assuming that minor update runs before upgrades, this should
take care of upgrades too.

Change-Id: Idabfec5f568a4e02900d103d23f4cb3c199e84c9
Related-Bug: #1833690

commit_message:
Fluentd: Update Clusterrole verbs

This updates the Fluentd clusterrole to allow for getting
namespaces, as this is required for the fluentd kubernetes
plugin to function correctly

Change-Id: Id9d735310c53a922a62c6a82121edd332e7df724
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

subject: add spec "show-server-numa-topology"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john@johngarbutt.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5754, 'name': 'Alex Xu', 'email': 'hejie.xu@intel.com', 'username': 'xuhj'}, {'_account_id': 7543, 'name': 'Yongli He', 'email': 'yongli.he@intel.com', 'username': 'yongli.he'}, {'_account_id': 8768, 'name': 'Chris Friesen', 'email': 'chris.friesen@windriver.com', 'username': 'cbf123'}, {'_account_id': 11604, 'name': 'sean mooney', 'email': 'smooney@redhat.com', 'username': 'sean-k-mooney'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23157, 'name': 'sean mooney', 'email': 'seanmooney8202@yahoo.ie', 'username': 'seanmooney8202'}, {'_account_id': 26936, 'name': 'Surya Seetharaman', 'email': 'suryaseetharaman.9@gmail.com', 'username': 'tssurya'}, {'_account_id': 28715, 'name': 'Jim Gauld', 'email': 'James.Gauld@windriver.com', 'username': 'jgauld'}]

[{'account_id': 7543, 'date': '2019-05-13 02:31:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2019-05-13 15:40:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Normally we would fast track approve as this was previously approved, but given the discussion at the PTG, I will just +2.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2019-05-13 15:42:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-05-21 13:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thanks, John. I think the cores and threads should be removed also. Hope Sean to have a look at.'}, {'account_id': 7543, 'date': '2019-05-22 07:19:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-05-23 04:16:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-05-28 02:21:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

FYI, I have talk with Sean on the IRC, here is the log http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2019-05-21.log.html#t2019-05-21T13:05:02

We agreed on move sockets, cores, hugepage stuff out of numa node structure, if they want those fields.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-05-28 14:24:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(13 comments)

so ignoring the spelling/grammar issues
i think this simplified version is fine.

the vm wide aspects like the cpu topology have been extracted
up one level in the data model and the information exposed has been reduced.

as such this leaks less of the implementation details then the version form last cycle so i would hope this is at least somewhat portable to hypervisors other then libvirt in the future.

so im +1 because you have addressed my main concerns but it would be good to fix up the typos.

the only other commet i would have is i am still not convince that this api is really that useful for debuging or as an enduser as the info outside of the gust to host pinnings is already  contained in the image+flavor but if you have a customer asking for this i think its still valid.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-05-28 14:32:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-05-28 14:36:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7543, 'date': '2019-05-29 07:06:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7543, 'date': '2019-05-29 07:25:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(15 comments)'}, {'account_id': 28715, 'date': '2019-05-29 14:57:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

@Sean. Rationale for exposing this and detailed info.
Customers end up having complex systems with multiple hosts and many servers, some with hyper-threading, PCI on specific NUMA nodes; Then ask "why server did not schedule but they expect it to", then the admin/end-user have trouble understanding numa, and how to add things up.

Eg, Say you have 10 hosts and 200 servers, using a variety of flavors of cpus, memory, hugepages and sizes, policies, with PCI devices associated with numa nodes, NUMA and HT constraints, etc. If you had the output more like the following, it becomes just more obvious how NUMA nodes were filling up.

I am showing the following example (with one line of output per server per-NUMA Cell), including more related info than what we are ending up with in this spec, to show the original intent for wanting this spec, since we were getting this support question.  When you actually have 200 servers, you could see at a glance where things were going, but definitely this is an 'admin' view.

nova list --all --host controller-0 --fields=res:topology,res:pci_devices
+--------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------+
| ID                                   | res: Topology                                                                       | res: Pci Devices                                              |
+--------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------+
| f943c5cd-e821-4253-b16e-0b34674e2cee | node:0,  1024MB, pgsize:2M, 1s,4c,1t, vcpus:0-3, pcpus:8,10,12,14, pol:ded, thr:pre | node:0, addr:0000:06:00.0, type:PF, vendor:8086, product:10fb |
+--------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------+

Eg, This is abbreviated format: This says the server cell is on numa 0, using 1024MiB of 2M hugepages, has 1socket,4cores,1thread topology, has vcpus:0,1,2,3  (i.e., vcpu_set), these vcpus map to: 8,10,12,14 (i.e. cpu_pinning), flavor has 'hw:cpu_policy=dedicated', 'hw:cpu_thread_policy=prefer', has PCI on numa, with specific device attributes.'}, {'account_id': 7543, 'date': '2019-05-31 01:19:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7543, 'date': '2019-05-31 02:50:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-06-04 13:11:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-06-05 19:20:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

one nit inline but im happy with the current version.
thanks for updating this.'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-06-18 07:41:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-06-18 07:43:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Only -1 for the wrong comment about vcpu_set and slibings are controlled by the host_info policy. Then LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 7543, 'date': '2019-06-18 07:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-06-18 07:45:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7543, 'date': '2019-06-18 07:46:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-06-24 20:06:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

In case it's helpful to reviewers, here's a consolidated/abbreviated diff from the approved stein version [1] to PS5 of the train version (this patch): http://paste.openstack.org/raw/753325/

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/stein/approved/show-server-numa-topology.html"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-06-25 13:44:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2019-06-25 13:58:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(13 comments)

I'm not super jazzed about exposing the host hardware information, but it's protected by default from user view and it sounds like there's a lot of support for it. The exposure of the guest topology itself seems fine to me.

I noted a lot of grammar changes which I think should be fixed in a followup."}, {'account_id': 7543, 'date': '2019-06-26 01:55:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(14 comments)

grammar and 4k fix composite to a little patch:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/667487/'}]

add spec "show-server-numa-topology"

This spec present numa information in server diagnostic API.

APIImpact
bp: show-server-numa-topology

Change-Id: I60b16eee2f03a78382b735ccad588d0d619e7693

commit_message:
Move existing Zuul project config to projects.yaml

There was a project stanza in zuul.d/jobs.yaml which was unexpected.
Move it to projects.yaml and combine it with the one just added.

Change-Id: Ie3b2e31833423ae8658861e8cc85300d45882f8e

commit_message:
Bump Ansible to 2.7.x

Ansible 2.5.x reached end-of-life last month.

filter dict2items is introduced in ansible-2.6. 

Update version to unblock multinode-oooq-container-updates job that
fails with next error msg: template error while templating 
string: no filter named 'dict2items'.

Other notable fixes:
- blockinfile
- lineinfile
- docker modules
- loop 

Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/386
Change-Id: I8a04063763516f32d9b2fbe29eab64ccc4f2e5f6

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-25 09:15:46.000000000', 'message': 'Queens only - allow SSH from any source

With change I89cff59947dda3f51482486c41a3d67c4aa36a3e
SSH was limited to the ctlplane_subnet only. This changes
the previous behaviour that allowed SSH from any source.

The use of hiera introduced a regression where overcloud
nodes on remote subnet in a DCN (or spine-and-leaf) set
up are not available via SSH from the undercloud or from
overcloud nodes in other sites/leafs.

Introducing the tripleo::firewall::firewall_rules to allow
operators to define more granular ssh firewall rules does
make sense, but changeing the default will also break
users doing monitoring or management/maintenance
operations via SSH.

Change-Id: I8c8ca93744934746d588c7228caa2950a53b23ce
Closes-Bug: #1834161
(cherry picked from commit d8ef4512b8dcb9f2295f154dd2a9a82684f34260)
'}]
commit_message:
Queens only - allow SSH from any source

With change I89cff59947dda3f51482486c41a3d67c4aa36a3e
SSH was limited to the ctlplane_subnet only. This changes
the previous behaviour that allowed SSH from any source.

The use of hiera introduced a regression where overcloud
nodes on remote subnet in a DCN (or spine-and-leaf) set
up are not available via SSH from the undercloud or from
overcloud nodes in other sites/leafs.

Introducing the tripleo::firewall::firewall_rules to allow
operators to define more granular ssh firewall rules does
make sense, but changeing the default will also break
users doing monitoring or management/maintenance
operations via SSH.

Change-Id: I8c8ca93744934746d588c7228caa2950a53b23ce
Closes-Bug: #1834161
(cherry picked from commit d8ef4512b8dcb9f2295f154dd2a9a82684f34260)

commit_message:
Make comparisons case insensitive

If the values for the conditional checks are "true" rather than "True",
they would be skipped. Let's force the variable contents to lowercase to
remove the possibility of skipping the check when the value is "true"

Change-Id: I9f288ee2771c0a954beee085b6df650419978422
Closes-Bug: #1833441

commit_message:
Enable Request Filter for Image Types

This change enables `scheduler/query_placement_for_image_type_support`
by default for all deployments. Setting it causes the scheduler to ask
placement only for compute hosts that support the disk_format of the
image used in the request which is beneficial for example, the libvirt
driver, when using ceph as an ephemeral backend, does not support ``qcow2``
images (without an expensive conversion step).

Change-Id: I6d12a66616cc2cc65e62755e8a54084d65aeae5e
Closes-Bug: #1832738

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-25 09:15:19.000000000', 'message': 'Rocky only - allow SSH from any source

With change I89cff59947dda3f51482486c41a3d67c4aa36a3e
SSH was limited to the ctlplane_subnet only. This changes
the previous behaviour that allowed SSH from any source.

The use of hiera introduced a regression where overcloud
nodes on remote subnet in a DCN (or spine-and-leaf) set
up are not available via SSH from the undercloud or from
overcloud nodes in other sites/leafs.

Introducing the tripleo::firewall::firewall_rules to allow
operators to define more granular ssh firewall rules does
make sense, but changeing the default will also break
users doing monitoring or management/maintenance
operations via SSH.

Change-Id: I8c8ca93744934746d588c7228caa2950a53b23ce
Closes-Bug: #1834161
'}]
commit_message:
Rocky only - allow SSH from any source

With change I89cff59947dda3f51482486c41a3d67c4aa36a3e
SSH was limited to the ctlplane_subnet only. This changes
the previous behaviour that allowed SSH from any source.

The use of hiera introduced a regression where overcloud
nodes on remote subnet in a DCN (or spine-and-leaf) set
up are not available via SSH from the undercloud or from
overcloud nodes in other sites/leafs.

Introducing the tripleo::firewall::firewall_rules to allow
operators to define more granular ssh firewall rules does
make sense, but changeing the default will also break
users doing monitoring or management/maintenance
operations via SSH.

Change-Id: I8c8ca93744934746d588c7228caa2950a53b23ce
Closes-Bug: #1834161

(6 comments)

I'm starting to realize the consensus I believed we had on the PTG is not really there yet. :-(

Please keep in mind that we have a tradeoff here. There's no best choice. We can either choose

1) better A, worse B, or
2) worse A, better B.

Just stating that A is better or worse is not enough to decide between the options. It feels like in this discussion some folks want better A, others want better B. I ask everybody to please consider the whole options."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-05-30 00:23:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Yes, it's a tradeoff. Having it Just Work(TM) is better for automation, while having it fail early has arguably less potential for confusing users poking at the API manually. (Both are a big improvement on failing randomly in use, as the current API does, though neither is entirely optimal.)

Personally I prefer to optimise for automation - not only because I've spent a lot of time working on a service for automating applications, but also because isn't that why we're all here? FWIW I don't feel that the potential for confusion is that high - when the user manually deletes an extraroute they'll do it by showing the list, finding the UUID, and issuing a delete with that UUID. If they happen not to notice a second UUID with the same content that time around and wonder why the route is still working, then the first thing they're likely to do is go back and list the extraroutes again at which point they will surely see it.

Still, it's y'all's project. This feature has been there for years and it doesn't work at all when automated, so clearly it's not the end of the world."}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2019-06-14 12:23:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2019-06-14 12:24:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Regarding the main content the new patch set is practically a revert to ps4.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-06-22 09:43:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2019-06-25 23:32:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-25 12:35:49.000000000', 'message': 'Atomic Extraroute API

As discussed in an openstack-discuss thread [1] we could improve the
extraroute API to better support Neutron API clients, especially Heat.

The problem is that the current extraroute API does not allow atomic
additions/deletions of particular routing table entries. In the current
API the routes attribute of a router (containing all routing table
entries) must be updated at once. Therefore additions and deletions
must be performed on the client side. Therefore multiple clients race
to update the routes attribute and updates may get lost.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005121.html

Change-Id: I10407a74102bfd16e3a0b8d2bd08c92acb4cc27f
Partial-Bug: #1826396

commit_message:
Improve Extraroute API

As discussed in an openstack-discuss thread [1] we could improve the
extraroute API to better support Neutron API clients, especially Heat.

The problem is that the current extraroute API does not allow atomic
additions/deletions of particular routing table entries. In the current
API the routes attribute of a router (containing all routing table
entries) must be updated at once. Therefore additions and deletions
must be performed on the client side. Therefore multiple clients race
to update the routes attribute and updates may get lost.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005121.html

Change-Id: I10407a74102bfd16e3a0b8d2bd08c92acb4cc27f
Partial-Bug: #1826396

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

1. Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.
2. Update the UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for tox[1]
3. Update some URLs to latest

[1]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/006478.html

Change-Id: Ibe8c402c2817c31748e6a4b8344024a276609260

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6469, 'name': 'Carlos Gonçalves', 'display_name': 'Carlos Goncalves', 'email': 'cgoncalves@redhat.com', 'username': 'cgoncalves'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 14288, 'name': 'Matthew Thode', 'display_name': 'prometheanfire', 'email': 'mthode@mthode.org', 'username': 'prometheanfire'}, {'_account_id': 21741, 'name': 'Andreas Florath', 'email': 'andreas@florath.net', 'username': 'florath'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-06-18 17:05:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2019-06-18 18:55:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This is (mostly) a copy&paste of the ubuntu-minimal element.
This is not the way these kind of things should be implemented.
Please either extend the existing ubuntu-minimal element that it is capable of handling this special case - or extract the common parts and use them from ubuntu-minimal and ubuntu-minimal-kvm.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-06-18 19:32:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I agree to some degree. I looked at extending the existing element by adding environment variables. This gets a bit messy due to the limitations of the package-install element. I would need to add an environment.d that checks for the presence of said environment variable and converts them to booleans that package-install can handle. Or, as you said, add a third level of dependencies that pulls out the kernel package and testing. I am open to feedback on the path to take from the core team. In the mean time I am using this to test the image with this kernel.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-06-19 03:49:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think this should be merged as well into the main Ubuntu element.
I faced similar problems with Gentoo (profiles, python versions supported, etc.).

https://github.com/openstack/diskimage-builder/blob/master/diskimage_builder/elements/gentoo/environment.d/00-gentoo-envars.bash

It looks like the package-installs has a 'when' value that can be set, so you could trigger off of a DIB_FEATURE_FLAG to uninstall the 'bad kernel' and install the 'good kernel'."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-06-19 06:25:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah, I kind of have to agree; there's a few places the copying has shown through like the copyrights, the titles in the README files for the tests, etc :)

I'd like to understand a bit more where the extra space comes from; the raw kernel+modules I don't think accounts for all of the listed difference; from the build pages

 linux-image-4.15.0-1036-kvm_4.15.0-1036.36_amd64.deb (4.1 MiB)
 linux-modules-4.15.0-1008-kvm_4.15.0-1008.8_amd64.deb (5.0 MiB)

 linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-20-generic_4.15.0-20.21_amd64.deb (7.6 MiB)
 linux-modules-4.15.0-20-generic_4.15.0-20.21_amd64.deb (12.4 MiB) 

so are we also bringing in extra modules or debug symbols somehow?

That said, I don't think it would be a bad thing to switch between generic/kvm/lowlatency/hwe kernels somehow? I know what you mean with the when:, as it doesn't have a default case.  maybe could be worked around (all pseudo code).  packages has:

 linux-image-hwe
  when: IMAGE_HWE
 linux-image-kvm
  when: IMAGE_KVM
 linux-image-rt
  when: IMAGE_RT
 linux-image-generic
  when: IMAGE_GENERIC

then in an environment file do in bash

 if [[ -z ${IMAGE_HWE:0} ]] && [[ -z ${IMAGE_RT:0} ]] ... etc ...; then
    # no more specific kernel selected; choose generic
    IMAGE_GENERIC=1
 fi

a bit ugly, but might work..."}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-06-19 21:09:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-06-19 21:11:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-06-19 21:12:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-06-19 22:10:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2019-06-19 22:15:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-06-19 22:17:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

yep, much cleaner imo'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-06-19 23:39:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-06-20 17:18:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-06-20 20:23:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck
bad mirror'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-06-20 23:53:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-06-21 16:00:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck
Wow, a lot of job instability here.'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2019-06-22 08:21:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

My tests:

                   qcow size     used size when bootet
    generic.qcow2  368M          873M
    virtual.qcow2  140M          371M
    kvm.qcow2      122M          330M

This is a big step when it comes to disk space optimization!'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-06-25 20:44:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add DIB_UBUNTU_KERNEL to ubuntu-minimal

This patch adds a new environment variable to the ubuntu-minimal
element called DIB_UBUNTU_KERNEL that allows you to specify the kernel
meta package that will be using to install the kernel inside the image.
It supports "linux-image-generic" (The default), "linux-image-kvm", and
"linux-image-virtual".
This allows building images that are smaller in size (~200MB smaller
qcow2) that have only the kernel modules necessary for virtual
machines.

Change-Id: I8ce65e1d357d15e8ed8995ad1dcaea02bbd1986f
